channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+2392] Hard Drive Weight Increasing?
[+2035] Dear Soda Machine Re-Stocker... [Pic]
[+1934] Which Way Is The Exit? [Pic]
item.description: This was photographed at a Hospital.....What happens incase of an emergency???

item.title: [+1516] Future You [Comic]
item.description: A man travels to the past and tries explaining Twitter to his younger self.

item.title: [+1271] Spotify Is the Best Desktop Music Player We've Ever Used
item.description: Imagine a music app with instant access to any song you wanted to hear. Imagine creating a playlist from those songs and quickly, easily sharing it with friends. Such an app does exist, it's called Spotify, and could just change music forever.

item.title: [+1263] CNN Rips Into Fraudulent Health Care CEO Anti-Reformer
item.description: A CNN anchor today tore down Rick Scott, the founder of an organization that's been funding anti-health care reform protests and the former CEO of a hospital company that paid $1.7 billion to settle charges of overcharging Medicare and Medicaid.

item.title: [+1037] Facebook messages from freshman roommate. He's a d*ck.
item.description: My cousin Jordan is starting his freshman year this coming August. He just got his roommate assignment and sent this over to me the other day.

item.title: [+1023] 10 mysteries of human behaviour that science can't explain
item.description: Scientists have split the atom, put men on the moon and discovered the DNA of which we are made, but there are 10 key mysteries of human behaviour which they have failed to fully explain.

item.title: [+1019] Your Hardware Exposed! 22 PC Parts Bare All [PICS]
item.description: You may know what the inside of a PC looks like, but what about the parts which make up your PC components? Over the past few years, we've dissected hard drives, keyboards, soundcards, and a plethora of other PC hardware, just to see what makes them tick. Here, we've picked out 22 of these autopsies to showcase.

item.title: [+976] How Did Hackers Cripple Twitter?
item.description: When Twitter slowed to a standstill early this morning, millions of their users fell victim to one of the oldest tricks in the Internet hacker handbook: the Distributed Denial-of-Service attack.

item.title: [+969] Technically Amazing Surf Photography
item.description: The often haunting photographs in this collection were all taken by immensely talented Jacob Cockle who lives "for art, music and good tea". An entrant in this year's Nike 6 Apprentice competition, I don't know how he didn't win.

item.title: [+904] Bill Maher: New Rule: Smart President Smart Country
item.description: New Rule: Just because a country elects a smart president doesn't make it a smart country. Before I go about demonstrating how, sadly, easy it is to prove this, let me just say that ignorance has life and death consequences.

item.title: [+899] My dog going thru depression resulting in attempted suicide
item.description: I walk downstairs only to find my dog going through depression resulting in attempted suicide.

item.title: [+886] Must Watch: Second Full Where the Wild Things Are Trailer!
[+823] Twitter, Facebook attack targeted one user
item.description: A Russian activist blogger with accounts on Twitter, Facebook, LiveJournal and Google's Blogger and YouTube was targeted in a denial of service attack that led to the site-wide outage at Twitter and problems at the other sites on Thursday, according to a Facebook executive.

item.title: [+694] Seven of the Fattiest Sandwiches in the U.S. [PICS]
item.description: If we’re going to drop money on a meal, particularly one as seemingly simple as a sandwich, it needs to be sufficiently satisfying and unique—in other words, a caloric bomb with the craziest ingredients you can imagine between two slices of bread.

item.title: [+679] GOP Official Poses as "Local Mom" & Grills Congressman (VID)
item.description: Here's a fun example of astroturfing in its purest form: A woman attending a town hall event for Rep. Steve Kagen (D-WI), and--while loudly raising objections to the Democrats' health care reform proposal--insisting she's just a regular concerned citizen. Except, she's actually a GOP official.

item.title: [+661] Student says he faces bankruptcy after $675K RIAA verdict
item.description: Boston University student Joel Tenenbaum, found guilty last week of illegally downloading and distributing 30 copyrighted songs -- and fined $675,000 by a jury -- has a lot to say about his case.

item.title: [+641] REPORT: Billy Mays used cocaine days before his death
item.description: The report states that "cocaine use caused or contributed to the development of his heart disease, and thereby contributed to his death."

item.title: [+639] 5 Secrets of the Photoshop Crop Tool with Screenshots Images
item.description: If you’re used to clicking the crop tool dragging the tool over your image and pressing Enter, it may surprise you to know that there are other options that you can use when cropping in Photoshop. Here are five “best-kept secrets” of the Photoshop crop tool.
